Class Obstacle

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.StaticBody
game.entities.Obstacle
public class Obstacle extends city.cs.engine.StaticBody
Represents a vibrating obstacle in the game.

This obstacle is a StaticBody that appears stationary to the physics engine but visually vibrates left and right at a fixed interval using a Timer.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private boolean
    movingRight
    A boolean flag indicating the current direction of vibration: true if moving right, false if moving left.
    private static final city.cs.engine.BodyImage
    OBSTACLE_IMAGE
    The visual image for the obstacle, scaled to 2 units in height.
    private static final city.cs.engine.Shape
    OBSTACLE_SHAPE
    The shape of the obstacle (a 2x2 square, since BoxShape sizes are half-width and half-height).
    private final float
    vibrationDistance
    The distance (in world units) that the obstacle moves left or right per vibration tick.
    private final Timer
    vibrationTimer
    A Swing Timer that periodically updates the obstacle's position to simulate a left-right vibration.

  • Field Details

    • OBSTACLE_SHAPE

      private static final city.cs.engine.Shape OBSTACLE_SHAPE

      private static final city.cs.engine.BodyImage OBSTACLE_IMAGE
      The visual image for the obstacle, scaled to 2 units in height.

  • Constructor Details

    • Obstacle

      public Obstacle(city.cs.engine.World world, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position)
      Constructs a vibrating Obstacle at the specified position in the given world.

      The obstacle vibrates left and right every 100 milliseconds, toggling direction each time.

      Parameters:
      world - The World in which the obstacle is placed.
      position - The initial position of the obstacle.

  • Method Details

    • stopMovement

      public void stopMovement()
      Stops the vibration timer so the obstacle no longer moves.

      Typically called when the game is paused to freeze all activity.

    • resumeMovement

      public void resumeMovement()
      Resumes the vibration timer so the obstacle continues vibrating.

      Typically called when the game is resumed.
